You try to stay to that game plan, and you'll have a chance, Chicago defensive end Julius Peppers said. But the Bears did more than that. They decided to pick their poison with Michael Vick and try to eliminate his run game by containing him in the pocket with rushers from the edge

President Bush at a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the UN two days later. Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting: We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Fieldhouse said the Ryan plan ignores "lessons learned from the Great Depression and underscored by the Great Recession" and still swears by the failed Bush-era economic policies of cutting taxes for the wealthy while neglecting the middle class and national investments. It even proposes the partial privatization of Social Security, an increase in taxes on the middle class, the elimination of corporate taxes, and the privatization of Medicare. Sen.
